collection:
## Human Genomic Data Submitted to Unrestricted-Access Repositories

If you plan to submit large-scale human genomic data, as defined by the [NIH
Genomic Data Sharing (GDS) Policy](https://osp.od.nih.gov/scientific-
sharing/genomic-data-sharing/), to be maintained in an unrestricted-access
NCBI database, NIH expects you to 1) submit an [Institutional
Certification](http://osp.od.nih.gov/scientific-sharing/institutional-
certifications/) to assure that the data submission and expectations defined
in the NIH GDS Policy have been met, 2) register the study in NCBI
[BioProject](/bioproject/) regardless of where the data will ultimately reside
(e.g., GenBank, SRA, GEO).

As a Center within the
NLM, we do not collect any personally identifiable information (PII) about
visitors to our Web sites.

We do collect some data about user visits to help
us better understand how the public uses the site and how to make it more
helpful.

The NCBI does not collect information for commercial marketing or any
purpose unrelated to [NCBI's Mission](../../about/mission/).
* Use the URL parameter email, and tool for distributed software, so that we can track your project and contact you if there is a problem.
